title: Problems installing Catch2 `v3.0.0-preview3` from sources

labels.name: Resolved - pending review
labels.description: Issue waiting for feedback from the original author

body:
I try to build a fixed version with the following commands as specified in https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/devel/docs/cmake-integration.md#top .  

```sh
git clone https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2.git
cd Catch2
cmake -Bbuild -H. -DBUILD_TESTING=OFF
sudo cmake --build build/ --target install
```

**Platform information:**
- OS: Ubuntu 21.04
 - Compiler+version: **GCC 11.2.0**
 - Catch version: **v3.0.0-preview3**

# Error

```
In file included from /usr/include/signal.h:328,
                 from /home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/../catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.hpp:37,
                 from /home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.cpp:8:
/home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.cpp:94:58: error: call to non-‘constexpr’ function ‘long int sysconf(int)’
   94 |     static constexpr std::size_t sigStackSize = 32768 >= MINSIGSTKSZ ? 32768 : MINSIGSTKSZ;
      |                                                          ^~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/sigstksz.h:24,
                 from /usr/include/signal.h:328,
                 from /home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/../catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.hpp:37,
                 from /home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.cpp:8:
/usr/include/unistd.h:640:17: note: ‘long int sysconf(int)’ declared here
  640 | extern long int sysconf (int __name) __THROW;
      |                 ^~~~~~~
/home/rmueller/Software/Catch2/src/catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.cpp:150:45: error: size of array ‘altStackMem’ is not an integral constant-expression
  150 |     char FatalConditionHandler::altStackMem[sigStackSize] = {};
      |                                             ^~~~~~~~~~~~
gmake[2]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/Catch2.dir/build.make:433: src/CMakeFiles/Catch2.dir/catch2/internal/catch_fatal_condition_handler.cpp.o] Error 1
gmake[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:142: src/CMakeFiles/Catch2.dir/all] Error 2
gmake: *** [Makefile:171: all] Error 2
```

On `develop` it compiles. I think it would be good to make a new preview release because the last tag https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/tree/v3.0.0-preview3 is already ~2 years old / 300-400 commits behind. We had the issue that I compiled unittests with Catch2 based on `develop`, and then the tests failed on a CI/CD server which fetched  `v3.0.0-preview3`. We don't really want to fetch unstable `develop` , but we'd like to use some features which are not part of `v3.0.0-preview3` so a new intermediate release would be good. What do you think?
